definition: to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)

sentences.english: Mr. Munson spat on one of the windows.
sentences.chinese: 老李隨即啐了一口吐沫在酒吧的一扇窗戶上。

sentences.english: Originally the phrase means two fish out of water moisten each other with saliva to keep each other alive temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 原指離開水的魚相互吐沫沾溼，以求得暫時的生存。

sentences.english: He spit on his hands and rubbed them together.
sentences.chinese: 往手掌上吐口吐沫，雙手搓了幾下。

sentences.english: You never saw two idiots exchange saliva before?
sentences.chinese: 你沒見過兩個白癡交換吐沫媽？

sentences.english: She was paraded in the streets where children spat at her face and threw stones at her.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們往她臉上吐吐沫還用石頭砸她。

definition: to spit/fig. to spit out (a request, an agreement etc)
Xingzi county in Jiujiang 九江, Jiangxi
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
